column1: #Text=The (Fe0.83Ga0.17)100−xPtx polycrystalline samples (x represents the atomic percentages; x = 0, 0.2, 0.4, 0.6, 0.8 and 1.0) were prepared by using high purity metals of Fe (99.95%), Ga (99.99%) and Pt (99.99%) by arc-melting techniques under argon atmosphere.
#Text=Considering the lower melting point of Ga, excessive 1 mol% of Ga was added to compensate the losses during the melting process.
#Text=To ensure compositional homogeneity, each sample (~ 7 g) was melted four times and the weight loss of the ingots was less than 1%.

#Text=The as-cast ingots were sectioned into slices with a thickness of 1 mm by wire-cutting and sealed into a quartz tube, filled with argon gas, followed by a heat treatment at 1000 °C for 3 h, and then quenched into water.
#Text=The directionally solidified samples were prepared at 1680 °C with the pulling rate of 5 µm/s.

#Text=The X-ray diffraction (XRD) patterns were measured by using a Bruker D8 ADVANCE Diffractometer (Cu–Kα, λ = 1.5406 Å) and the lattice constants of FeGa–Pt alloys were calculated by using Nielsen extrapolation method.
